page.title: 12MITCHELDEAN SECONDARY SCHOOL
page.content: 1985 will be remembered as a very important year in the history of Secondary education in the Mitcheldean area. After several years of discussion the Abenhall Secondary Modern School at Mitcheldean became an 11 to 16 Comprehensive, and changed its name to Dene Magna School. Before this date Mitcheldean and Drybrook children went either to Abenhall or the Royal Forest of Dean Grammar School, which is outside the block, near Coleford. However children staying on after the age of 16 will still have to travel, as the Grammar School became a Tertiary College serving Dene Magna and other Secondary Comprehensive schools in the eastern and central area of the Forest of Dean.
